title: X3/X4 Not Responding to Velocity Commands in Local Cloudsim

content.raw:
Note: this was working late last week and I cleared pulled the new SubT image this morning from the Docker hub as well as rebuilt the cloudsim\_sim and cloudsim\_bridge images with no-cache.

Velocity commands are sent on the /<robot\_ns>/cmd\_vel for X1/X2/X3/X4 and the velocity commands work for X1/X2 but do not work for X3/X4.  The rotors do not spin up so the velocity commands are not being piped correctly on the Ignition side or piped correctly from the cloudsim\_bridge to the Ignition side \(it appears cloudsim\_bridge is listening to the correct topics for all 4 robots and thus should be pulling velocity commands correctly\).  

I did check #97 and the API and it appears that the message type \(geometry\_msgs::Twist\) has remained the same and the topic name has remained the same \(cmd\_vel\).
content.html:
Note: this was working late last week and I cleared pulled the new SubT image this morning from the Docker hub as well as rebuilt the cloudsim_sim and cloudsim_bridge images with no-cache.

Velocity commands are sent on the /<robot_ns>/cmd_vel for X1/X2/X3/X4 and the velocity commands work for X1/X2 but do not work for X3/X4. The rotors do not spin up so the velocity commands are not being piped correctly on the Ignition side or piped correctly from the cloudsim_bridge to the Ignition side (it appears cloudsim_bridge is listening to the correct topics for all 4 robots and thus should be pulling velocity commands correctly).

I did check #97 and the API and it appears that the message type (geometry_msgs::Twist) has remained the same and the topic name has remained the same (cmd_vel).
